subject: Ethics
title: Extinction Ethics
description: A micro-lesson that makes Extinction Ethics usable.

hook.text: The last male northern white rhino died in 2018 with armed guards by his side. His species dies with him.

buildup.text: Earth is losing species 1,000 times faster than the natural rate. Scientists call it the sixth mass extinction.

discovery.text: Extinction is forever. Unlike pollution, you can't clean it upâ€”once a species is gone, it's gone.

twist.text: But we spend millions saving pandas while ignoring ugly insects that hold ecosystems together.

climax.text: The ethical question isn't just 'should we save species?' but 'who decides which ones are worth saving?'

punchline.text: Every extinction is a door that closes permanently.

quiz.question: What ethical bias affects which species we choose to protect?
options: We tend to protect charismatic or beautiful species while ignoring ecologically vital but less appealing ones
All species receive equal conservation funding worldwide
Only species useful to humans are worth protecting
